Submodules¶

genoml.nlp.bedtools module¶

class genoml.nlp.bedtools.BedTool(fn=None, from_string=False, remote=False)¶

Bases: pybedtools.bedtool.BedTool

Class to wrap pybedtools.BedTool for use with machine learning and natural language processing

alphabet = None¶
complement = None¶
create_corpus(intervals, k, fasta=None, upstream=0, downstream=0, offset=1, sep='', processes=1, chunksize=1)¶

Create corpus of kmer tokens from intervals

Parameters:
  • intervals (list) – list of interval indexes or pybedtools Interval objects
  • k (int) – size of each kmer
  • fasta (str/io.TextIOWrapper) – path to fasta file or stream (default: None)
  • upstream (int) – number of bases upstream from each interval to read (default: 0)
  • downstream (int) – number of bases downstream from each interval to read (default: 0)
  • offset (int) – shift offset between kmers in each interval (default: 1)
  • sep (str) – delimiter for token ‘words’
  • processes (int) – number of worker processes to use
  • chunksize (int) – size of each chunk submitted to a worker process
Returns:

corpus of kmer tokens from intervals
Return type:

list
read_expression_levels(intervals, expr=None, sample_regex=None, processes=1, chunksize=1)¶

Read expression levels for genes corresponding to all given intervals

Parameters:
  • intervals (list) – list of interval indexes or pybedtools Interval objects
  • expr (str) – path to normalized feature count table (default: None)
  • sample_regex (str) – regex to filter by sample name (default: None)
  • processes (int) – number of worker processes to use
  • chunksize (int) – size of each chunk submitted to a worker process
Returns:

mean expression level for gene corresponding to interval
Return type:

numpy.ndarray
read_kmers(interval, k, fasta=None, upstream=0, downstream=0, offset=1)¶

Read kmers from sequence from annotated interval in fasta file

Parameters:
  • interval (int/Interval) – index of interval or pybedtools Interval object
  • k (int) – size of each kmer
  • fasta (str/io.TextIOWrapper) – path to fasta file or stream (default: None)
  • upstream (int) – number of bases upstream from interval to read (default: 0)
  • downstream (int) – number of bases downstream from interval to read (default: 0)
  • offset (int) – shift offset between kmers in interval (default: 1)
Returns:

list of kmers in interval
Return type:

KmerList
read_seq(interval, fasta=None, upstream=0, downstream=0)¶

Read sequence from annotated interval in fasta file

Parameters:
  • interval (int/Interval) – index of interval or pybedtools Interval object
  • fasta (str/io.TextIOWrapper) – path to fasta file or stream (default: None)
  • upstream (int) – number of bases upstream from interval to read (default: 0)
  • downstream (int) – number of bases downstream from interval to read (default: 0)
Returns:

raw interval sequence from fasta file
Return type:

string
read_tokens(interval, k, fasta=None, upstream=0, downstream=0, offset=1)¶

Read tokens from sequence from annotated interval in fasta file

Parameters:
  • interval (int/Interval) – index of interval or pybedtools Interval object
  • k (int) – size of each kmer
  • fasta (str/io.TextIOWrapper) – path to fasta file or stream (default: None)
  • upstream (int) – number of bases upstream from interval to read (default: 0)
  • downstream (int) – number of bases downstream from interval to read (default: 0)
  • offset (int) – shift offset between kmers in interval (default: 1)
Returns:

list of kmer tokens in interval
Return type:

KmerList.TokenList
remove_invalid(*args, **kwargs)¶

Wrapper for pybedtools.BedTool.remove_invalid(*args, **kwargs)

Removes invalid entries from GTF/GFF files (i.e. chromosomes with negative coordinates or features of zero length

saveas(*args, **kwargs)¶

Wrapper for pybedtools.BedTool.saveas(*args, **kwargs)

Creates tempfile to store intermediate data, allows IntervalIterator to reset

subset_feature(feature_type)¶

Extract feature type from each gene

Parameters:feature_type (str) – type of gene feature (e.g. five_prime_utr, three_prime_utr, exon, etc.)
Returns:pybedtools interval iterator limited to region_type intervals
Return type:BedTool
